class src.core.Instrument(name=None, parameters=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

generic instrument class

for subclass overwrite following functions / properties:
  • _parameters_default => parameter object, that is a list of parameters that can be set to configure the instrument
  • update => function that sends parameter changes to the instrument
  • values => dictionary that contains all the values that can be read from the instrument
  • get_values => function that actually requests the values from the instrument
  • is_connected => property that checks if instrument is actually connected

class src.core.Parameter(name, value=None, valid_values=None, info=None)[source]¶

Bases: dict

__dict__ = dict_proxy({'info': <property object at 0x00000000045DF138>, '__dict__': <attribute '__dict__' of 'Parameter' objects>, '__module__': 'src.core.parameter', 'is_valid': <staticmethod object at 0x0000000004690198>, 'valid_values': <property object at 0x00000000045DF048>, '__setitem__': <function __setitem__ at 0x000000000466E0B8>, '__weakref__': <attribute '__weakref__' of 'Parameter' objects>, 'update': <function update at 0x000000000466E128>, '__init__': <function __init__ at 0x00000000043534A8>, '__doc__': None})¶
__init__(name, value=None, valid_values=None, info=None)[source]¶

Parameter(name, value, valid_values, info) Parameter(name, value, valid_values) Parameter(name, value) Parameter({name: value})

Future updates: Parameter({name1: value1, name2: value2}) Parameter([p1, p2]), where p1 and p2 are parameter objects

Parameters:
  • name – name of parameter
  • value – value of parameter can be any basic type or a list
  • valid_values – defines which values are accepted for value can be a type or a list if not provided => type(value)
  • info – description of parameter, if not provided => empty string
